analyzed: drang srong lnga brgya po rnams gdul ba'i dus la bab bo snyam du dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas drang srong lnga brgya po de dag gis me'i sbyin sreg gi /
translated: The Bhagavān thought, The time has come to tame the five hundred sages.🔽

original: thab de dag thams cad kyi nang du sangs rgyas kyi zhabs kyi rjes mthong la de phan chad me sbar mi nus pa de lta bur byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: thab de dag thams cad kyi nang du sangs rgyas kyi zhabs kyi rjes mthong la de phan chad me sbar mi nus pa de lta bur byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: The Blessed One thought, The time has come to tame the five hundred sages. With that thought, the Blessed One blessed the situation so that the five hundred sages would see the Buddha's footprints in the middle of all the fire pits for the burnt offerings.

original: de nas de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: After that, the sages would not be able to light the fires.

original: rjes 'di'i mthus bdag cag gis me'i thab rnams kyi nang du me sbar mi nus par gyur pa las na /🔽rjes 'di ni /
analyzed: rjes 'di'i mthus bdag cag gis me'i thab rnams kyi nang du me sbar mi nus par gyur pa las na / rjes 'di ni /
translated: The sages thought, Because of the power of these footprints, we cannot light the fires in the middle of the fire pits.

original: dge ba zhig yin pa 'dra ste /
analyzed: dge ba zhig yin pa 'dra ste /
translated: These footprints must be those of a virtuous being.🔽These footprints must be those of the great god.

original: rjes 'di lha chen po'i rjes ma yin grang snyam nas drang srong lnga brgya po de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi rjes de dag la bsreg bya phul nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus sbyin sreg de dag rang 'bar bar gyur te /
analyzed: rjes 'di lha chen po'i rjes ma yin grang snyam nas drang srong lnga brgya po de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi rjes de dag la bsreg bya phul nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus sbyin sreg de dag rang 'bar bar gyur te /
translated: The five hundred sages offered their burnt offerings to the Buddha's footprints. By the Buddha's power, the burnt offerings ignited by themselves.

original: me lce tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la thug par song ngo //
analyzed: me lce tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la thug par song ngo //
translated: The flames reached the Brahma world.

original: de nas drang srong rnams kyis de mthong nas ya mtshan du gyur te lha chen pos bdag la dgongs so snyam mo //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams drang @4a *//
analyzed: de nas drang srong rnams kyis de mthong nas ya mtshan du gyur te lha chen pos bdag la dgongs so snyam mo // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams drang @4a *//
translated: Then the sages, seeing this, were amazed and thought, “The Great God is thinking of me.”

original: ba'i phyir rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal la thug pa'i bar du zhabs kyi rjes gcig nas gcig tu byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: ba'i phyir rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal la thug pa'i bar du zhabs kyi rjes gcig nas gcig tu byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to guide them, blessed the ground so that there was a single footprint leading from one to the other, all the way to the garden of Prince Jeta.

original: de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They thought,

original: lha chen po ni /
analyzed: lha chen po ni /
translated: “The Great God

original: lam 'dir gshegs so snyam nas zhabs kyi rjes gcig nas gcig tu rjes de dag la mchod pa byed cing dong nas de dag mthar gyis rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal du zhugs so //
analyzed: lam 'dir gshegs so snyam nas zhabs kyi rjes gcig nas gcig tu rjes de dag la mchod pa byed cing dong nas de dag mthar gyis rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal du zhugs so //
translated: has come this way.” Following the footprints, they made offerings to them one by one. They went on and eventually entered the garden of Prince Jeta.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i gung la bzhugs te chos ston te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i gung la bzhugs te chos ston te /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One was sitting in the middle of a circle of many hundreds of retinues, teaching the Dharma.

original: de nas drang srong lnga brgya po de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan cing spa bar byas pa /
analyzed: de nas drang srong lnga brgya po de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan cing spa bar byas pa /
translated: Then the five hundred seers saw the Buddha, the Blessed One, his body adorned and beautified with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: me lus kyi dbyibs su 'dug pa lta bu /
analyzed: me lus kyi dbyibs su 'dug pa lta bu /
translated: He was like a fire in the shape of a human body,

original: me lce mar gyis btab pa lta bu /
analyzed: me lce mar gyis btab pa lta bu /
translated: like a flame of fire anointed with ghee,

original: mar me gser gyi snod du bzhag pa lta bu /
analyzed: mar me gser gyi snod du bzhag pa lta bu /
translated: like a lamp placed in a golden vessel,

original: mchod sdong rin po che sna tshogs kyis spras pa lta bu /
analyzed: mchod sdong rin po che sna tshogs kyis spras pa lta bu /
translated: like a sacrificial post adorned with various jewels,

original: blo gsal zhing dri ma med la rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: blo gsal zhing dri ma med la rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: and his mind was clear, stainless, and pure.

original: mthong nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba skyes te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang mchog tu dga' ba skyes te /
translated: When they saw him, they were overjoyed.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems can gyis dang po sangs rgyas mthong ba'i nyams bde ba de ci 'dra ba de lta bu ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems can gyis dang po sangs rgyas mthong ba'i nyams bde ba de ci 'dra ba de lta bu ni /
translated: The bliss of seeing the Buddha for the first time, which arises from the cause of accumulating roots of virtue, is like this.

original: lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du zhi gnas kyi sems la goms par byas pa la yang nyams bde ba @4b de lta bu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du zhi gnas kyi sems la goms par byas pa la yang nyams bde ba @4b de lta bu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they were to practice mental stability for twelve years, they would not experience such bliss.

original: de ltar mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan sngar 'khod do //
analyzed: de ltar mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan sngar 'khod do //
translated: Having seen this, they went to the Blessed One. Upon their arrival, they bowed their heads at his feet and sat before him to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: The Blessed One directly apprehended their thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperaments, capacities, and natures, and taught them the Dharma accordingly.🔽As soon as they heard it, they actualized the fruit of nonreturner right where they sat.

original: des na drang srong de dag gis stan de nyid la 'khod bzhin du bden pa rtogs pa'i mod la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas so; ;de dag gis bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom
analyzed: des na drang srong de dag gis stan de nyid la 'khod bzhin du bden pa rtogs pa'i mod la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas so; ;de dag gis bden pa mthong nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom
translated: Having seen the truths, they rose from their seats, drew down the right shoulder of their upper garments, bowed toward the Blessed One with palms pressed together, and made this request:🔽“Blessed One, if permitted we wish to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well spoken, complete our novitiate, and achieve full ordination.

original: ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa / bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs shing dge slong gi dngos po 'thob tu rung na /
translated: “Lord, if it is possible for us to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well spoken, complete the monastic training, and achieve the state of a monk,

original: bdag cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'tshal lo //
translated: then we too would like to practice the holy life in the presence of the Blessed One.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshig gis rab tu byung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de rnams la lung yang phog ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba'i tshig gis rab tu byung ste bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas de rnams la lung yang phog ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One gave them the going forth with the words “Come, monk,” and with the words “Complete the monastic training” he gave them full ordination.

original: de rnams kyis kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs @5a *//
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang brtson pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bad pas nyon mongs @5a *//
translated: They received the Buddha’s instructions and through diligence, practice, and effort

original: thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: they abandoned all defilements and actualized the state of an arhat.

original: de dag dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
analyzed: de dag dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
translated: They became equal in regard to praise and blame, fame and lack of fame, pleasant and unpleasant.🔽They became like the earth, for they were not soiled by worldly dharmas.

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /🔽tsan dang spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa / tsan dang spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
translated: They became like the sky, for their minds were like the sky.

original: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
translated: They became cool like sandalwood and aloe, for their mental afflictions were pacified.🔽They became like a diamond, for they had pierced through the shell.

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /🔽srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa / srid pa'i rnyed pa dang chags pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba /
translated: They became endowed with knowledge, clairvoyance, and confidence,

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smras pa'i gnas su gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang gus par smras pa'i gnas su gyur to //
translated: and they became objects of worship, honor, and respect for Indra, Upendra, and the other gods.

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Then the monks requested the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis drang srong 'di rnams zhabs kyi rjes bstan pas drangs te g-yung drung gi mthar thug pa /
analyzed: btsun pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis drang srong 'di rnams zhabs kyi rjes bstan pas drangs te g-yung drung gi mthar thug pa /
translated: “Lord, the Blessed One has led these sages to the end of the wholesome roots by showing them the footprints of the Blessed One.

original: grub pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa la gzigs /
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa la gzigs /
translated: He has established them in the happiness of the nirvāṇa that is an arhat’s perfect peace.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽da ltar 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / da ltar 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'das pa'i dus na yang drang srong lnga brgya po 'di rnams ji ltar zhabs kyi rjes bstan pas drangs te rab tu phyung nas tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad du bcug pa de nyon cig /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yang drang srong lnga brgya po 'di rnams ji ltar zhabs kyi rjes bstan pas drangs te rab tu phyung nas tshe gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa spyad du bcug pa de nyon cig /
translated: “This is not the first time they have been led by the example of my footprints and then gone forth to practice pure conduct all their lives.

original: dge slong dag /🔽sngon byung ba @5b 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye rgu'i tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /🔽bde bar gshegs pa; 'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag / sngon byung ba @5b 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la skye rgu'i tshe lo nyi khri thub pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa / bde bar gshegs pa; 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: Monks,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /

translated: in protecting the head, in shooting from a distance, in shooting with a loud noise, in shooting to the vital point, in shooting to be sure to hit, and in shooting with great force. He became skilled in the five fields.

analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na de'i pha ma gnyis shi nas de rgyal po gzugs can snying pos glang po che'i blar bskos te pha'i las thabs de nyid byin no //

analyzed: de nas des thabs zlar bab pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //

analyzed: de rab tu byung nas sde snod gsum bslabs te rig pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa dang ldan pa'i chos smra bar gyur to //

analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na des bsam pa / bdag gis thos pa'i sgo nas bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni /

analyzed: da phyin chad ni /

analyzed: bdag gis yid la byed pa la 'bad par bya'o //

original: snyam du bsam ste des yid la byed pa bzung nas @26a *//

translated: He practiced without sleeping at dawn and dusk, and by abiding in this way, he generated the meditative concentration of the base of neither perception nor non-perception. He gathered five hundred disciples and became surrounded by a retinue.

translated: Later, he went wandering through the countryside with his retinue.

original: zhes gsol te /
analyzed: zhes gsol te /

analyzed: de yang bu ma mchis te /

analyzed: de ci bdog pa thams cad lha gcig mnga' lags so // zhes byas so //

original: de nas rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos smras pa /

analyzed: zhes byas nas rgyal pos de'i khyim nas ci yang ma bzhes so //

analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na de'i chung mas nag pa glang chen gnas 'khor lnga brgya dang bcas pa rgyal po'i khab tu lhags so //

analyzed: ci 'di bya ba byas pa yin nam /

analyzed: 'on te so so'i skye @26b bo yin zhig gu /

analyzed: gal te so so'i skye bo yin na ni /
translated: If he is an ordinary person,🔽I will find a way to seduce him.”

analyzed: des de mthong nas bsam pa /

analyzed: 'di ni / dgra bcom pa ma yin te /

The next day he gave food to his retinue of one hundred and fifty and said,

analyzed: de nas khol ba khye'u des kyang de kho na bzhin du byas nas bud med des smras pa /

analyzed: de nas thos ma thag tu nag pa glang chen gnas khro ba'i kun tu dkris pa chen po skyes nas de khros pas chung mas snga nas mal du ral gri bzhag pa de blangs nas shubs las phyung ste khye'u de'i steng du brgyugs nas chung mas rkang pa
translated: As soon as he heard this, Kālamegha became very angry. In his rage he grabbed the sword his wife had placed on the bed earlier, drew it from its scabbard, and ran at the boy. His wife

translated: threw herself at his feet and said,

analyzed: de nas nag pa glang chen gnas kyis chung ma de nyid kyi mdun du bslab pa'i gzhi rnams phul te /

analyzed: jo bos 'di la 'khon du mi gzung bar gsol; jo bo'i khyim gyi 'byor ba ni /
translated: The wealth of the master’s house is

analyzed: da slan chad jo bo 'dod pa rnams kyang spyod cing bzhugs shig /

translated: give gifts,

analyzed: de nas rgyal po gzugs can snying pos nag pa glang po chen gnas kyis bslab pa rnams phul te nyams par byas so //
translated: Then King Bimbisāra heard that the elephant Nālāgiri had been released by Pūrṇa and had been tamed.

analyzed: zhes thos nas rgyal pos de la dgug pa btang nas de la sngon gyi las thabs byin no //

translated: Having heard it, they took their alms in Rājagṛha, ate their meal, gave up their afternoon alms, put away their bowls and robes, washed their feet, and went to where the Blessed One was staying.

analyzed: phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: When they arrived, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas dge slong mang po rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When they were seated to one side, the many monks said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa / 'di na bdag cag dge slong mang po snga dro sham thabs dang chos gos 'tshal te lhung bzed thogs nas rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms la mchis pa na /

analyzed: btsun pa / bdag cag dge slong mang po rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms la rgyu ba rnams kyis nag pa glang chen gnas kyis bslab pa rnams phul @28a *// te nyams par bgyis so // zhes thos lags so //
translated: “Lord, we have heard that many monks, while wandering for alms in Rājagṛha, have had their precepts violated and their faith destroyed by Kṛṣṇa the elephant trainer.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ni yun ring du khyim du mi gnas te /
translated: that son of noble family will not remain in the household for long.

original: de ni / yang nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bka' stsal to //

translated: He will go forth in my very doctrine, abandon all the defilements, and actualize the state of an arhat.”

analyzed: de dag gis bden pa mthong nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu de ya mtshan du gyur to //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: The Blessed One directly apprehended his thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, capacity, and nature, and taught him the Dharma accordingly.

original: des na khye'u mi'am cis stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /

translated: As a result, while the young kinnara was still sitting there, he leveled the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection with the vajra of wisdom and manifested the resultant state of stream entry.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: “Monks, in the past, in the city of Vārāṇasī, there lived a certain brahman. He took a wife of equal caste and together they played, made love, and enjoyed themselves.

analyzed: phyi zhig na de'i chung ma la bu chags te / de zla ba dgu'am /

analyzed: sngom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'o // gang po zhes @54a *//
translated: This is the concluding verse.

original: bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya ba ni /
translated: Pūrṇa

original: gleng gzhi rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs te /
translated: The setting was Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe lho phyogs kyi ri'i ljongs na ri brags kyi grong zhig na bram ze che zhing ma tho ba phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: de'i tshe lho phyogs kyi ri'i ljongs na ri brags kyi grong zhig na bram ze che zhing ma tho ba phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba /
translated: At that time, in a mountain village in the south, there lived a brahman named Pūrṇa, who was of high caste, wealthy, with much wealth and property,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba /🔽rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang mnyam pa /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba / rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang mnyam pa /
translated: with vast and extensive possessions,🔽with wealth equal to that of Vaiśravaṇa,

original: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa /
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa /
translated: rivaling the wealth of Vaiśravaṇa,

original: byams pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: byams pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: with a loving nature,

original: snying rje dang ldan pa /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa /
translated: compassionate,

original: sems can la gnyes gshin pa /
analyzed: sems can la gnyes gshin pa /
translated: kind to sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad la snying brtse ba gang po zhes bya ba zhig gnas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying brtse ba gang po zhes bya ba zhig gnas te /
translated: and full of love for all beings.

original: de ni / khyim na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / slong ba rnams la gtong zhing sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de ni / khyim na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / slong ba rnams la gtong zhing sdud par byed do //
translated: He was generous to householders, renunciants, and beggars, and he was a collector of wealth.

original: dus dus su mchod sbyin gyi gnas bcas nas mchod sbyin yang byed do //
analyzed: dus dus su mchod sbyin gyi gnas bcas nas mchod sbyin yang byed do //
translated: From time to time he would set up a sacrificial fire and make offerings.

original: de nas mchod sbyin gyi dus shig la bab pa'i tshe bstan bcos thams cad kyi gzhung rnams la rtog cing gang dang gang gi lta ba ci 'dra ba zhig snyam ste /
analyzed: de nas mchod sbyin gyi dus shig la bab pa'i tshe bstan bcos thams cad kyi gzhung rnams la rtog cing gang dang gang gi lta ba ci 'dra ba zhig snyam ste /
translated: Then, when the time came for a sacrifice, he examined the texts of all the treatises, wondering what the views of each were.

original: des gzhung de dag yid la bzhag nas sems pa dang / 'jal ba dang / yongs su rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: des gzhung de dag yid la bzhag nas sems pa dang / 'jal ba dang / yongs su rtogs par byed do //
translated: He kept those texts in mind, and he reflected, weighed, and fully understood them.

original: de nas phyi zhig na bram ze des mchod sbyin bya bar brtsams nas mchod sbyin byed pa der ston pa thams cad 'dus par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na bram ze des mchod sbyin bya bar brtsams nas mchod sbyin byed pa der ston pa thams cad 'dus par gyur to //
translated: Then, on another occasion, the brahmin began to make a sacrifice, and all the teachers gathered for the sacrifice.

original: bram ze des kyang ston pa thams cad kyi gzhung yid la bzhag nas sems pa la zhugs pa las /
analyzed: bram ze des kyang ston pa thams cad kyi gzhung yid la bzhag nas sems pa la zhugs pa las /
translated: The brahmin kept in mind the texts of all the teachers and began to reflect.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa de dag @54b la sems mgu bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa de dag @54b la sems mgu bar ma gyur to //
translated: But his mind was not satisfied with those views.

original: de nas phyi zhig na rgyal po'i khab na gnas pa'i dge bsnyen rnams kyis bram ze de'i mdun du sangs rgyas kyi bsngags pa brjod do //
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na rgyal po'i khab na gnas pa'i dge bsnyen rnams kyis bram ze de'i mdun du sangs rgyas kyi bsngags pa brjod do //
translated: Then one day the lay disciples of Rājagṛha praised the Buddha in the presence of the brahmin.

original: de nas de thos ma thag tu bram ze de bcom ldan 'das la blta 'dod par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu bram ze de bcom ldan 'das la blta 'dod par gyur to //
translated: As soon as he heard this, the brahmin became eager to see the Blessed One.

original: de nas phyi zhig na de'i blo skyes pa /
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na de'i blo skyes pa /
translated: Then one day he had this thought:

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze stong phrag du ma bdag gi mchod sbyin la 'ongs nas longs spyod par byed la /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze stong phrag du ma bdag gi mchod sbyin la 'ongs nas longs spyod par byed la /
translated: “Many thousands of ascetics and brahmins have come to my sacrifice and enjoyed themselves.

original: bcom ldan 'das go'u ta ma de ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das go'u ta ma de ni /
translated: But the Blessed Gautama

original: mi 'ong na /
analyzed: mi 'ong na /
translated: has not come.

original: kye ma de yang bdag gi mchod sbyin la 'ongs te longs spyod par byed kyang ci ma rung snyam mo //
analyzed: kye ma de yang bdag gi mchod sbyin la 'ongs te longs spyod par byed kyang ci ma rung snyam mo //
translated: Oh, how I wish that he would come to my sacrifice and enjoy himself!”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze de'i sems thugs kyis mkhyen nas dgongs pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze de'i sems thugs kyis mkhyen nas dgongs pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing with his mind the thoughts of that brahmin, thought,

original: bram ze 'dis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par sems bskyed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bram ze 'dis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par sems bskyed par 'gyur la /
translated: “This brahmin will arouse the irreversible intention to attain unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: de kho na la brten te bdag gis skye bo mang po la phan gdags so snyam du dgongs nas dge slong mang pos zham ring byas te dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bdar nas bram ze de la thugs brtse ba'i phyir ri brags kyi grong khyer
analyzed: de kho na la brten te bdag gis skye bo mang po la phan gdags so snyam du dgongs nas dge slong mang pos zham ring byas te dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bdar nas bram ze de la thugs brtse ba'i phyir ri brags kyi grong khyer
translated: “I will benefit many people by relying on him.”

original: der gshegs so //
analyzed: der gshegs so //
translated: Surrounded by many monks, with the saṅgha of monks in front of him, the Blessed One went to the town of the mountain village out of compassion for the brahmin.

original: bcom ldan 'das der bshegs nas 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das der bshegs nas 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: When the Blessed One arrived there, he thought,

original: ma la bdag gis ci nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas der mchod sbyin gyi bdag po dang / skye bo mang po gzhan rnams kyis bdag gcig pu mthong la /
analyzed: ma la bdag gis ci nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas der mchod sbyin gyi bdag po dang / skye bo mang po gzhan rnams kyis bdag gcig pu mthong la /
translated: “Now, I will bless the place of the sacrifice so that the master of the sacrifice and the other people will see only me,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams sus kyang mi mthong ba @55a *//🔽de lta bur byin gyis brlab bo snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams sus kyang mi mthong ba @55a *// de lta bur byin gyis brlab bo snyam du dgongs te /
translated: and no one will see the saṅgha of monks.”

original: de ltar byin gyis brlabs nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su gshegs so //
analyzed: de ltar byin gyis brlabs nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su gshegs so //
translated: Having blessed it in that way, he went to the place of the sacrifice.

original: de nas bram ze des thag ring po zhig nas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas bram ze des thag ring po zhig nas bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: Then the brahmin saw the Blessed One from a distance.

original: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa legs so //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa legs so //
translated: Having seen him, he said this to the Blessed One:🔽“Blessed One, it is good that you have come.

original: bcom ldan 'das tshur gshegs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshur gshegs /
translated: Blessed One, please come in.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi mchod sbyin gyi gnas su mchod pa rnams longs spyod par mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi mchod sbyin gyi gnas su mchod pa rnams longs spyod par mdzad du gsol /
translated: Blessed One, please enjoy the offerings at my sacrificial site.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang po / khyod kyis nga'i lhung bzed 'di bza' ba dang / bca' bdag gis ma bkang gi bar du longs spyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang po / khyod kyis nga'i lhung bzed 'di bza' ba dang / bca' bdag gis ma bkang gi bar du longs spyod par mi bya'o //
translated: “Pūrṇa, you should not enjoy it until you have filled my begging bowl with food and drink.”

original: bram ze des smras pa /
analyzed: bram ze des smras pa /
translated: The brahmin said,

original: bcom ldan 'das go'u ta ma ji ltar dgongs pa de bzhin du bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das go'u ta ma ji ltar dgongs pa de bzhin du bgyi'o //
translated: “Blessed Gautama, I will do as you wish.”

original: zhes gsol nas bram ze des mchod sbyin byed pa der bza' ba dang / bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po mang po bshams pa de dag blangs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed dgang bar byas nas dgang ma nus nas des nga rgyal bskyed de /
analyzed: zhes gsol nas bram ze des mchod sbyin byed pa der bza' ba dang / bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po mang po bshams pa de dag blangs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed dgang bar byas nas dgang ma nus nas des nga rgyal bskyed de /
translated: Having said that, the brahmin took the many good, clean foods and drinks that had been prepared for the sacrifice and filled the Blessed One’s begging bowl. When he was unable to fill it, he became proud and said,🔽“Gautama, I am a brahmin who has mastered the three Vedas.

original: bdag gis lhung bzed 'di ma gang du mi gtang ngo snyam nas g-yog 'khor dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed bza' ba dang bca' bas dgang ba la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: bdag gis lhung bzed 'di ma gang du mi gtang ngo snyam nas g-yog 'khor dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed bza' ba dang bca' bas dgang ba la brtson par byed do //
translated: So he and his retinue filled the Blessed One’s alms bowl with food and drink.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,🔽“Now, with this food, I can feed a thousand monks.”

original: da @55b ni; kha zas 'dis dge slong stong gi zan chog go snyam du dgongs nas lhung bzed de gang bar bstan to //
analyzed: da @55b ni; kha zas 'dis dge slong stong gi zan chog go snyam du dgongs nas lhung bzed de gang bar bstan to //
translated: So he displayed the bowl as full.

original: de nas bram ze des bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed gang bar mthong nas dga' bar gyur te gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas bram ze des bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed gang bar mthong nas dga' bar gyur te gsol pa /
translated: When the brahmin saw that the Blessed One’s bowl was full, he was delighted and said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed bltams lags kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed bltams lags kyi /
translated: “The Blessed One’s alms bowl is full.

original: bcom ldan 'das go'u ta mas ci bder gsol cig ces byas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das go'u ta mas ci bder gsol cig ces byas so //
translated: Blessed Gautama, please eat as much as you like.”

original: de nas bram ze de la thugs brtse ba'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi gnas de nyid du dge slong stong gi stan sprul te chur rnams bkang nas bcom ldan 'das gral gyi gtso la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bram ze de la thugs brtse ba'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi gnas de nyid du dge slong stong gi stan sprul te chur rnams bkang nas bcom ldan 'das gral gyi gtso la bzhugs so //
translated: Then, out of compassion for the brahmin, the Blessed One emanated a thousand seats for monks at the site of the sacrifice. He filled the bowls with water and sat down at the head of the row.

original: dge slong gzhan rnams kyang rgan rims bzhin bkod do //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan rnams kyang rgan rims bzhin bkod do //
translated: The other monks were seated in order of seniority.

original: de nas dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams bde bar bzhugs nas 'brim mkhan rnams kyis brims so //
analyzed: de nas dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams bde bar bzhugs nas 'brim mkhan rnams kyis brims so //
translated: When the assembly of monks was seated, the servers served the food.

original: de nas bram ze des kyang de dag thams cad mthong nas mthong ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das la shin tu dga' bar gyur te dge sbyong go'u ta ma 'di ni /
analyzed: de nas bram ze des kyang de dag thams cad mthong nas mthong ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das la shin tu dga' bar gyur te dge sbyong go'u ta ma 'di ni /
translated: The brahmin saw all this, and as soon as he saw it, he felt a surge of joy toward the Blessed One.

original: rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba yin no snyam ste /
translated: He thought, “This ascetic Gautama is one of great miracles and great power.”

original: dga' bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te gsol pa /
analyzed: dga' bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te gsol pa /
translated: With joy, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and said,

original: zla ba gsum gyi bar du bcom ldan 'das go'u ta ma dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams sbyar bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: zla ba gsum gyi bar du bcom ldan 'das go'u ta ma dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams sbyar bar 'tshal na /
translated: “If I were to provide the Blessed Gautama and the community of monks with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick for three months,🔽would the Blessed One accept?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la gnang bar mdzad du gsol /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das @56a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la gnang bar mdzad du gsol /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das @56a *//
translated: The Blessed One

original: kyis bram ze de la cad mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: kyis bram ze de la cad mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the brahmin by his silence.

original: de nas bram ze des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal du yo byad thams cad sbyar te sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la zla ba gsum gyi bar du yo byad thams cad
analyzed: de nas bram ze des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal du yo byad thams cad sbyar te sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la zla ba gsum gyi bar du yo byad thams cad
translated: Then the brahmin, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by his silence, prepared all the provisions in the Jeta Grove, and for three months served the Buddha and the saṅgha of monks with all their needs.

original: kyis bsnyen bskur byas nas tha ma'i nyin par sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pa gsol nas bcom ldan 'das la na bza' 'bum ri ba phul lo //
analyzed: kyis bsnyen bskur byas nas tha ma'i nyin par sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pa gsol nas bcom ldan 'das la na bza' 'bum ri ba phul lo //
translated: On the last day, he offered the Buddha and the saṅgha of monks food of a hundred flavors, and to the Blessed One he offered a robe worth a hundred thousand.

original: dge slong gzhan dag la yang re re la ras zung re phul nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag la yang re re la ras zung re phul nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab ste /
translated: He also offered a pair of garments to each of the other monks, and made an aspiration for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment:

original: kye ma dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis na bdag 'jig rten long ba /
analyzed: kye ma dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis na bdag 'jig rten long ba /
translated: Oh! By this root of virtue, may I become a protector for the world's blind who are without a guide,🔽without an island,

original: 'dren pa med pa /
analyzed: 'dren pa med pa /
translated: without a shelter,

original: ston pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: ston pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: “May I become a teacher, a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha, one with knowledge and feet,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a blissful one,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: a charioteer who guides beings, an unsurpassed being,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans,🔽a blessed buddha.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su gyur cig ces byas so; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze de la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su gyur cig ces byas so; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the brahmin,

original: bram ze / legs so legs so /
analyzed: bram ze / legs so legs so /
translated: “Excellent, brahmin, excellent!

original: bram ze / khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'jig rten long ba /
analyzed: bram ze / khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'jig rten long ba /
translated: Brahmin, in the future, when the world is blind,

original: 'dren pa @56b med pa; ston pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: 'dren pa @56b med pa; ston pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: without a guide, and without a teacher, you will become a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha, one with knowledge and feet,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a blissful one,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa; skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa; skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: a knower of the world, a charioteer who guides beings, an unsurpassed being,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans,🔽a blessed buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang po zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang po zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be the Buddha named Pūrṇa.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas de nyid du mi snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas de nyid du mi snang bar gyur te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having prophesied the brahman’s unsurpassed and perfect awakening, disappeared from the site of the sacrifice.

original: 'od ma'i tshal du zhugs par gyur to ////
analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal du zhugs par gyur to ////
translated: He returned to the Bamboo Grove.🔽The Sacrifice

original: mchod sbyin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod sbyin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Story of the Sacrifice

original: gleng gzhi mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs te /
translated: Once, the Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na bram ze zhig gnas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na bram ze zhig gnas te /
translated: At that time, there was a brahman living in Śrāvastī.

original: des thabs zlar bab pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las /
analyzed: des thabs zlar bab pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig tu rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las /
translated: He took a wife from a suitable family, and they played, made love, and enjoyed themselves.

original: phyi zhig na de'i chung ma la bu chags te /
analyzed: phyi zhig na de'i chung ma la bu chags te /
translated: After some time, his wife conceived.

original: de zla ba dgu'am /
analyzed: de zla ba dgu'am /
translated: After nine or ten months,

original: bcu lon pa dang / khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig btsas te /
analyzed: bcu lon pa dang / khye'u gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig btsas te /
translated: she gave birth to a child who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

original: de'i btsas ston rgyas par byas nas rigs dang mthun pa'i ming btags te 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / zhun mar dang / mar gyi snying khus bskyed bsrings nas gang gi tshe de cher skyes pa de'i tshe yi ge dang / bram ze'i spyod lam dang /
analyzed: de'i btsas ston rgyas par byas nas rigs dang mthun pa'i ming btags te 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / zhun mar dang / mar gyi snying khus bskyed bsrings nas gang gi tshe de cher skyes pa de'i tshe yi ge dang / bram ze'i spyod lam dang /
translated: At the elaborate feast celebrating his birth they gave him a name in keeping with his family. They nurtured him with milk, yogurt, butter, ghee, and milk solids, and as he grew up he learned letters, the conduct of brahmins,

original: spyod pa dang / aom zhes bya ba dang / bho zhes bya ba dang / @57a *//
analyzed: spyod pa dang / aom zhes bya ba dang / bho zhes bya ba dang / @57a *//
translated: the Oṃ and the BHO,🔽purity and ritual, how to hold a ritual vase and ashes, the Ṛg Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sāma Veda, the Atharva Veda, how to perform sacrifices,

original: gtsang spra dang / cho ga dang / thal ba blang ba dang / ril ba thogs pa dang / nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin bya ba dang /
analyzed: gtsang spra dang / cho ga dang / thal ba blang ba dang / ril ba thogs pa dang / nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin bya ba dang /
translated: and how to recite the Vedas.

original: mchod sbyin byed du gzhug pa dang / sbyin pa dang / blang ba dang / kha ton bya ba dang / kha ton slob tu gzhug pa'i thabs bslabs nas las rnam pa drug la mkhas pa'i bram zer gyur te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin byed du gzhug pa dang / sbyin pa dang / blang ba dang / kha ton bya ba dang / kha ton slob tu gzhug pa'i thabs bslabs nas las rnam pa drug la mkhas pa'i bram zer gyur te /
translated: He became a brahman skilled in the six duties of a brahman: giving, receiving, reciting, teaching recitation, sacrificing, and officiating at sacrifices.

original: de mthar gyis rig pa'i gnas bco brgyad la byang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de mthar gyis rig pa'i gnas bco brgyad la byang bar gyur to //
translated: In due course he became skilled in the eighteen branches of knowledge.

original: des bstan bcos thams cad khong du chud nas gzhung gi rtsod pa thams cad tshar bcad do //
analyzed: des bstan bcos thams cad khong du chud nas gzhung gi rtsod pa thams cad tshar bcad do //
translated: Having mastered all the treatises, he defeated all the disputations of the scriptures.

original: de nas phyi zhig na de'i pha ma gnyis shi nas des bsam pa /
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na de'i pha ma gnyis shi nas des bsam pa /
translated: Then one day his parents died. He thought,

original: byad gzugs dang thos pa bdag dang mtshungs pa yang med na lhag pa lta ga la yod snyam mo //
analyzed: byad gzugs dang thos pa bdag dang mtshungs pa yang med na lhag pa lta ga la yod snyam mo //
translated: “There is no one equal to me in appearance and learning, let alone superior.”

original: de'i pha yang sngon dus dus su mchod sbyin byed de /
analyzed: de'i pha yang sngon dus dus su mchod sbyin byed de /
translated: His father had previously performed sacrifices at the proper times.

original: bram ze de rnams kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: bram ze de rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: The brahmans said to him,

original: khye'u / khyod kyi pha yang dus dus su mchod sbyin byed kyi /
analyzed: khye'u / khyod kyi pha yang dus dus su mchod sbyin byed kyi /
translated: “Young man, your father also performed sacrifices at the proper times.

original: khyod kyis kyang pha'i lugs dang mthun par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang pha'i lugs dang mthun par gyis shig /
translated: You should also follow your father’s tradition.”

original: khye'u de na re /
analyzed: khye'u de na re /
translated: The young man said,

original: byad gzugs dang thos pa bdag dang mtshungs pa med na /
analyzed: byad gzugs dang thos pa bdag dang mtshungs pa med na /
translated: “There is no one equal to me in appearance and learning.

original: ci'i phyir bdag gis 'di dag la sbyin pa sbyin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag gis 'di dag la sbyin pa sbyin zhes zer ro //
translated: Why should I give these things to them?”

original: de nas de thos ma thag tu bram ze de dag de la mi dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de thos ma thag tu bram ze de dag de la mi dga' bar gyur te /
translated: As soon as the brahmins heard this, they became displeased with him.

original: de dag gis phyin chad de dang mi 'drul bar nang @57b khrims bcas so //
analyzed: de dag gis phyin chad de dang mi 'drul bar nang @57b khrims bcas so //
translated: They made a rule that they would not associate with him anymore.

original: de yang de dag la mi dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: de yang de dag la mi dga' bar gyur te /
translated: He, too, became displeased with them.

original: bdag la yon gnas 'di lta bu dag ci dgos snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag la yon gnas 'di lta bu dag ci dgos snyam mo //
translated: “What do I need with such people as these?” he thought.

original: de nas phyi zhig na bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa la /
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa la /
translated: Then one day the Blessed One thought,

original: bram ze'i khye'u 'dis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par sems bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u 'dis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par sems bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: “This young brahmin will develop the irreversible intention to achieve unsurpassable, perfect awakening.”

original: snyam du dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal nas mi snang bar gyur te bram ze'i khye'u de'i khyim du sa brtol te gyen du 'phags nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od btang ste /🔽des khyim de thog thag tu gser zhun ma'i kha dog lta bur snang bar byas so //
analyzed: snyam du dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal nas mi snang bar gyur te bram ze'i khye'u de'i khyim du sa brtol te gyen du 'phags nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od btang ste / des khyim de thog thag tu gser zhun ma'i kha dog lta bur snang bar byas so //
translated: Thinking this, the Blessed One disappeared from the garden of Prince Jeta and appeared in the house of the young brahmin, breaking through the roof and illuminating the house with a golden light.

original: de nas de mthong ma thag tu bram ze'i khye'u de bcom ldan 'das la shin tu dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de mthong ma thag tu bram ze'i khye'u de bcom ldan 'das la shin tu dga' bar gyur to //
translated: As soon as the young brahmin saw this, he felt a surge of joy toward the Blessed One.

original: dga' bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan bshams te 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: dga' bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan bshams te 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: With joy in his heart, he prepared a seat for the Blessed One and said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa la bzhugs su gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa la bzhugs su gsol /
translated: “Blessed One, please sit on the seat I have prepared.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One sat on the seat prepared for him.

original: bzhugs nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze'i khye'u de la sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos de lta bu bstan te /
analyzed: bzhugs nas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze'i khye'u de la sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos de lta bu bstan te /
translated: Once he was seated, the Blessed One taught the young brahmin the Dharma in a way that was connected with generosity.

original: de nas bram ze'i khye'u de sbyin pa btang ba'i 'dod pa skyes nas de sbyin pa byed 'dod pas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bram ze'i khye'u de sbyin pa btang ba'i 'dod pa skyes nas de sbyin pa byed 'dod pas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the young brahmin, having the desire to give, wanting to give, said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa / bdag gis sbyin pa dag byin zhing bsod nams dag bgyid par rngo lthogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu bdag @58a *//
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag gis sbyin pa dag byin zhing bsod nams dag bgyid par rngo lthogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu bdag @58a *//
translated: “Venerable, I am not able to give gifts and make merit like that.

original: la mi bdog lags so //
analyzed: la mi bdog lags so //
translated: I have no such thing.🔽🔽

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la gter bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la gter bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One revealed a treasure to him.

original: de mthong ma thag tu khye'u de bcom ldan 'das la lhag par yang dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: de mthong ma thag tu khye'u de bcom ldan 'das la lhag par yang dga' bar gyur to //
translated: As soon as he saw it, the young man became even more pleased with the Blessed One.

original: dga' bar gyur nas zhabs la phyag 'tshal te gsol pa /
analyzed: dga' bar gyur nas zhabs la phyag 'tshal te gsol pa /
translated: Having become pleased, he bowed down at his feet and said,

original: zla ba gsum gyi bar du bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong sbyar bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: zla ba gsum gyi bar du bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong sbyar bar 'tshal na /
translated: “If I were to provide for the Blessed One and the community of monks for three months with robes, food, bedding, seats, and medicines for the sick,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la gnang bar mdzad du gsol de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze'i khye'u de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la gnang bar mdzad du gsol de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze'i khye'u de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: Please grant me permission, O Blessed One. The Blessed One assented to the young brahmin by his silence.

original: de nas bram ze'i khye'u des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas mnyan du yod pa dang / rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi bar du mchod sbyin gyi gnas bcas nas dril bsgrags te /
analyzed: de nas bram ze'i khye'u des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas mnyan du yod pa dang / rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi bar du mchod sbyin gyi gnas bcas nas dril bsgrags te /
translated: Then, the young brahmin, understanding that the Blessed One had assented by his silence, having prepared a sacrificial ground between Śrāvastī and the Jeta Grove, had it announced with a proclamation:

original: bdag ya mtshan can thams cad la mchod sbyin bgyid kyi /
analyzed: bdag ya mtshan can thams cad la mchod sbyin bgyid kyi /
translated: I will perform a sacrifice to all the wonder-workers.

original: su mchod ston dang yon 'dod pa de dag bdag gi mchod sbyin gyi gnas su shog la longs spyad par gyis shig /
analyzed: su mchod ston dang yon 'dod pa de dag bdag gi mchod sbyin gyi gnas su shog la longs spyad par gyis shig /
translated: Those who desire a feast and gifts, let them come to my sacrificial ground and enjoy themselves.

original: de nas bram ze rnams na re /
analyzed: de nas bram ze rnams na re /
translated: Then the brahmins said:

original: bram ze la sdang ba la bdag cag longs spyod par mi byed ces zer ro //
analyzed: bram ze la sdang ba la bdag cag longs spyod par mi byed ces zer ro //
translated: We will not enjoy ourselves with those who hate brahmins.

original: de nas bram ze'i khye'us smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bram ze'i khye'us smras pa /
translated: Then the young brahmin said:

original: gal te longs spyod par mi byed na /
analyzed: gal te longs spyod par mi byed na /
translated: If you will not enjoy yourselves,

original: bdag gis khyed kyi phyir yon dpag pa gang yin @58b pa de dag thams cad bdag gis dge sbyong go'u ta ma 'khor dang bcas pa la phul la /
analyzed: bdag gis khyed kyi phyir yon dpag pa gang yin @58b pa de dag thams cad bdag gis dge sbyong go'u ta ma 'khor dang bcas pa la phul la /
translated: “Whatever sacrificial fee I have set aside for you, I will offer it all to the ascetic Gautama and his community.

original: de kho na'i bstan pa la tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i bstan pa la tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
translated: I will practice pure conduct under his teachings alone.”

original: de nas bram ze rnams kyis bsam pa /
analyzed: de nas bram ze rnams kyis bsam pa /
translated: Then the brahmins thought,

original: bram ze'i khye'u 'di ni /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u 'di ni /
translated: “This young brahmin

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin du byed pa yin pas na /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin du byed pa yin pas na /
translated: does what he says.

original: des de kho na ltar byed srid de /
analyzed: des de kho na ltar byed srid de /
translated: He might do just that.

original: de lta na bdag cag yon gyis pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na bdag cag yon gyis pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, we will be defeated by the sacrificial fee.”

original: snyam nas de dag gis de'i nang khrims bshig nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su song ste longs spyod do //
analyzed: snyam nas de dag gis de'i nang khrims bshig nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su song ste longs spyod do //
translated: So they broke their agreement with him and went to the sacrificial ground to enjoy themselves.

original: de nas bram ze'i khye'u des zla ba gsum gyi bar du ya mtshan can rnams kyi bza' ba dang bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po sbyar nas thams cad la yon mang po phul te tha ma'i nyin par sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams
analyzed: de nas bram ze'i khye'u des zla ba gsum gyi bar du ya mtshan can rnams kyi bza' ba dang bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po sbyar nas thams cad la yon mang po phul te tha ma'i nyin par sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams
translated: Then the young brahmin, for three months, prepared pure, good food for the ascetics, and gave much wealth to all of them. On the last day, he satisfied the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks

original: zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pas tshim par byas nas bcom ldan 'das la na bza' 'bum ri ba phul lo //
analyzed: zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pas tshim par byas nas bcom ldan 'das la na bza' 'bum ri ba phul lo //
translated: with food having a hundred flavors, and offered the Bhagavān a robe worth a hundred thousand.

original: dge slong gzhan rnams la yang re re la ras zung re phul lo //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan rnams la yang re re la ras zung re phul lo //
translated: He also offered each of the other monks a pair of garments.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gser gyi mdog lta bu'i mtshan gyis brgyan pa mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gser gyi mdog lta bu'i mtshan gyis brgyan pa mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab ste /
translated: Then, seeing the Bhagavān’s body, adorned with the marks, the color of gold, he made an aspiration to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment:

original: kye ma dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis na bdag 'jig rten long ba /
analyzed: kye ma dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis na bdag 'jig rten long ba /
translated: “Oh! By this root of virtue, may I become a protector for the world’s blind who are without a guide,🔽without an island,

original: 'dren pa med pa /
analyzed: 'dren pa med pa /
translated: without a shelter,

analyzed: ston pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa / bde bar @59a *// gshegs pa / 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa / lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: “Without a teacher, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, endowed with wisdom and conduct,🔽the Sugata,🔽the Knower of the world,🔽the Guide of people to be tamed, the peerless one,🔽the Teacher of gods and humans,🔽

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su gyur cig ces byas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su gyur cig ces byas so //
translated: “May I become a teacher, a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened buddha, perfect in wisdom and conduct, a sugata, a knower of the world, a tamer of persons, a charioteer, an unsurpassed one, a teacher of humans and gods—a blessed buddha.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze'i khye'u de la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze'i khye'u de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the young brahmin,

analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u /
translated: “Young brahmin,

analyzed: khyod legs so legs so //
translated: excellent, excellent!

analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u; khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'jig rten long ba /

translated: without a guide,

analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: He will be the teacher of gods and men,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das don gzigs zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das don gzigs zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the Blessed Buddha named Arthadarśin.”🔽After saying this, the Blessed One went to the monastery.🔽The Story of the Lazy Man🔽The Story of the Lazy Man🔽The Story of the Lazy Man
